snippet: The 21-to-5 vote by workers at Astoria Car Wash and Hi-Tek 10 Minute Lube Inc. is the first major victory in a six-month effort by organizers in New York City to reform the industry.
abstract: Workers at Astoria Car Wash and Hi-Tek 10 Minute Lube Inc in Queens vote 21 to 5 to join a union, in first major victory in New York City to unionize workers in an industry organizers say is rife with labor law violations; car wash will join the Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union, which will now seek to begin collective bargaining negotiations.
lead_paragraph: The 21-to-5 vote by workers at Astoria Car Wash and Hi-Tek 10 Minute Lube Inc. is the first major victory in a six-month effort by organizers in New York City to reform the industry.

headline.seo: Employees at a Queens Carwash Vote to Unionize
headline.main: Queens Carwash’s Employees Are First in City to Join Union
headline.print_headline: Queens Carwash’s Employees Are First in City to Join Union
